DOC.brief_summary: This study will evaluate the effects of nadroparin on survival and disease progression in patients with hormone-refractory prostate cancer (HRPC), locally advanced pancreatic cancer or non-small-cell lung carcinoma (NSCLC).
DOC.brief_title: Effects Of Nadroparin In Patients With Lung, Pancreas Or Prostate Cancer
DOC.criteria: Inclusion criteria: Hormone refractory prostate cancer within 6 months of diagnosis, OR locally advanced (nonmetastasized) pancreatic cancer within 3 months of diagnosis, OR nonsmallcell lung cancer within 3 months of stage IIIB. Exclusion criteria: Life expectancy of <3 months. Poor performance status (Karnofsky <60). Need to be on anticoagulants. Use of nadroparin (a low molecular weight heparin) for any reason including a history of heparininduced thrombocytopenia. Have brain metastasis. At a high risk of bleeding or have a platelet count <50,000/mm3. Have very poor kidney function.
